headline: Best Greek Quinoa Salad
description: This Greek quinoa salad includes tomatoes, kalamata olives, and feta cheese creating a Mediterranean-inspired, gluten-free salad.

video.description: Great for lunch or a light supper and packed with flavor!
video.name: Best Greek Quinoa Salad

name: Best Greek Quinoa Salad
recipeIngredient: 4 ounces chopped feta cheese, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring broth and quinoa to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until quinoa is tender and water has been absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes. Transfer quinoa to a large bowl and set aside to cool, about 10 minutes.

Mix tomatoes, parsley, kalamata olives, onion, feta cheese, olive oil, vinegar, and garlic into quinoa. Squeeze lemon juice over quinoa salad, season with salt and pepper, and toss to coat. Chill in refrigerator, 1 to 4 hours.

review.reviewBody: This is the first time I ever tried quinoa. I thought it was pretty good. Plus, I could pick little doo-dads out of the garden to mix in with it, like chives, parsley or sweet basil, cherry tomatoes, and spinach leaves. I tried several samples to see which way tasted best. The bed of spinach leaves, quinoa mixed with chives and cheese, and an egg over easy on the top was my favorite. No toast needed.
This was a simple and tasty salad. I will definitely make again and add other veggies next time to enhance.
Really flavorful and healthy

I love this recipe! Made it 4 times now and have enjoyed it so much. Family and friends ask for the recipe. The kids don’t appreciate it, but they are also very picky eaters. The only thing I add is fresh cucumber to give it a little crunch. Make it your own. You won’t be disappointed.

Quick and simple. Loved this recipie. I rinse my quinoa before cooking. Next time I'll add only 2 1/2 cups of broth due to the extra water from rinsing. No need to add extra salt as the olives and feta bring enough salt to the recipe. Will make again.
I added more veg to balance out the large amount of quinoa. chopped cucumber and chopped yellow and orange pepper. Teenagers did not like it, adults did.

So good - It never lasts long! I often cut back a little on the amount of quinoa (or you could up the other ingredients) as I like to have more of the goodies/veggies. This salad is a staple at my house.
Definitely cut the amount of grain in half. I added more lemon juice for flavor and added chopped cucumber. Very good and refreshing salad. Parsley is a must.
This salad is one of the best dishes! I followed other reviews and cut the quinoa in half and also added diced raw cucumber. This will forever be in our regular rotation.
Was super tasty and easy to make. I added chopped english cucumber and minced hot pepper.

This is a go to salad for my family. Sometimes I omit the olives. I also mix the vinegar, olive oil, & some lemon juice in a shaker to make a dressing to add after the other ingredients are mixed. It's delicious & elevates the salad to a side dish.

Made for second time. Minor changes were to add 1/2 an English cucumber, increased the quantity for a crowd, added a couple of Tbs. of fresh mint per suggestions from others, and added about a cup of garbanzo beans. Love this recipe and it doesn't require changing at all.
No. Delicious; perfect as is.

Delicious!!
I didn’t use chkn broth and substituted the red wine vinegar for wht wine vinegar because I didn’t have red. This salad is great for a cold dinner paired with grilled chkn! Yum
I enjoyed this!
I make this alot. I love it!

I made as directed. Next time I will omit the lemon altogether. It ruined what was an otherwise very nice flavored salad. (I tasted before adding lemon and it was delicious). I will also try adding cucumber and dill.
Great??

Delish for sure. I toasted the quinoa to add a nutty flavor before adding the chicken broth. I made a small mistake of not letting it cool enough before adding the Feta and it melted in--the flavor was still great. It made a lot so I shared with a neighbor and we all ate on it for several days.
I omitted the olives because neither my husband nor I like them - but other than that made as directed. This was a simple and yummy recipe. I would definitely make it again.

My new favorite salad. First time cooking quinoa. Love the lemon in it. Didn't have parsley, so I added a couple of chopped scallions. 

Loved it. Thanks for sharing.
Excellent! This was very good and I will definitely make it again.

This is a great basic recipe that can be modified easily to your personal tastes. I don't care for raw red onions so I substituted green onions. I am trying to get more colorful vegetables in my diet so I also added shredded carrots, diced cucumbers (peel on) and a variety of colors of sweet peppers. Because I am adding so much I 1/2 again the wet ingredients - vinegar, oil and lemon juice, as well as extra garlic. This is a very healthy salad loaded with protein. I plan to make this regularly and can't wait to have my friends try it at our next potluck!
I loved it! Great flavors!
Excellent....makes a large amount this recipe listed. Great for a large group, cut in half for smaller gathering.
Great recipe! I left out the feta because I dont like it. Still really good.
Made this for my sisters. It was a big hit.
Made just like the recipe said. Outstanding!! Everyone loved it!!
Wonderful recipe! Super tasty. I used balsamic vinegar instead of the cooking red wine and it was delicious!
Excellent alternative to tossed green salad. My husband loved it because it was something different and very tasty. Simple to make.
Delicious!!!
A little too tangy for me, next time I will cut back on vinegar and lemon juice. Did add crumbled feta at time of serving added great salty flavor.
Used lime instead of lemon. Excellent, fresh tasting dish!
great salad for a summer potluck!
Family enjoyed - especially Grant. Good recipe, especially for summer. Did not use all the quinoa. Next time omit the onions to appeal to entire family.
My whole family absolutely loved this salad! So easy to make with tons of flavour!
very good! left out the olives because I hate olives but it was really good. I thought it would be too lemony with fresh squeezed lemon juice but it was perfect!

I added yellow peppers and English cucumber and used black olives instead and only used 1/2 the lemon
It was delicious, great make ahead side dish for summer
An awesome recipe. I added cucumbers to it and because I didn’t have fresh parsley available, I added chopped spinach.
perfect!
I made a half batch yummy, we substituted spinach for parsley.
I made a half batch yummy, we substituted spinach for parsley.
Excellent!
Amazing!! Didn’t change one thing. Will make it again!

I was looking at quinoa tabbouleh and Greek quinoa salad recipes and decided to go with this one, though I did modify it a little. I omitted the olives, but added half of a large shredded carrot and half of a large diced cucumber. I didn't have a lemon on hand, so just used 2 tbsp of lemon juice. Delicious!

The salad was delicious! It had more of a delicate flavor than I was expecting. I used my rice cooker, as always, to prepare the quinoa. Using a 1 cup quinoa to 2 cups broth ratio, it gets perfect and fluffy every time. I made it exactly the way the recipe says with only one exception. I happened to have minced white onion on hand, so I used that instead of the red onion. The salad has a delicate Mediterranean allure. I will definitely be making this one again!
Made as sure directed! Will make again!
This was delicious! I also added other raw veggies - cucumbers, broccoli, and cauliflower . I will definitely make this again!

I did add more cucumber, sweet pepers & tomatoes 
It was good, made it for a pot luck luncheon, woemen enjoyed it.

This is all gone! I used some homemade vegetable juice I had canned instead of chicken broth. No matter! Turned out better than great! Took it to a potluck and was lucky that there were only 15 people there or I wouldn't have had any to bring home! Most of the crowd had never tried Quinoa so it was also an education to many.
Made this as a low FODMAP. Subbed green parts of spring onions and used garlic infused olive. Great flavor.
No changes it’s great the way it is!
This dish is so delicious and easy! Great for picnics, the pool, or the beach. I’m personally not a big fan of parsley so I add just a tad of it.

This is excellent, but you really have to use less quinoa (after experimentation, I like 2/3 the amount). Do use block feta chopped into small squares rather than crumbled if you can for a little more interesting flavor/texture. The other thing I like to do is to add diced red pepper and some extra garlic. I’ve added chicken, but I actually like it significantly better without.

Wow! Great salad. I also added roasted eggplant, roasted zucchini, peas, scallions, carrots, fresh basil, red pepper. I added a little Dijon mustard to the dressing and Parmesan cheese instead of feta.
Love it, great for lunch or light supper.
Love this recipe. I did add cilantro versus parsley & added some red pepper, SO good!
It was a great salad. We added some cucumber and red pepper also. The olives are a must but are a little expensive. Will make again.

We really, really enjoyed this recipe. I do the quinoa the night before so that it is completely cool before adding in the feta. The first time the feta sort of melted and I just like the feta in more chunks....personal preference. I also did the tomatoes with olive oil and garlic, to get them to really absorb the flavour and then add it. Great recipe for a really yummy alternative to a lettuce based Greek salad, making it bit more filling.

This has become one of my go to easy dinner recipes. It doesn't take long to make and is really packed with flavor. The fresh parsley is really important for the flavor, so make sure you have that! I also usually eliminate the olives because my boyfriend doesn't like them, and it might be better without them even though I am a huge olive fan! I think the olives end up adding too much salt to the dish so I'm happy without them.
So good as is!!
I liked it a lot but not really a hit with the family.

This is absolutely scrumptious. I did make some modifications and some additions. I doubled the veggies, feta and dressing amounts but kept the quinoa to 2 cups. It was a perfect amount as I am taking it to a potluck. I added fresh dill and oregano as I have an over abundance of those and was short on the parsley. I also completely replaced the vinegar with fresh squeezed lemon juice...I juiced three small lemons and added the zest of one. I rarely write reviews, but thought this one was definitely worth it! So good!!! (One last thing, even if your quinoa is prewashed, it's still good to rinse it thoroughly. I used red quinoa.)
HOLY COW this is the best way to make quinoa EVER. I will be saving this recipe for sure! Cooking the quinoa in chicken broth made it like Top Ramen..... YUM.

After cleaning out my pantry I discovered lots of quinoa to use. I found this recipe and was so happy I did. It was delicious! Will definitely be making this again. I did add some chopped cucumber at the last minute. Gave it a little crunch but the recipe as is is perfect!
I usually add some extra dressing. Otherwise it’s great!
my favorite quinoa salad so far!
I love this recipe.... I did add cucumbers and also minced mint...a little more feta
As recommended by others, I used 1/2 the quinoa and it was still a lot of quinoa. My Bunco guests seemed to enjoy it, but I would not bother making it again.
Delicious recipe as written, didn't change a thing. Will definitely be making this again but will probably cut the recipe in half as it makes a lot- although it's even better the next day!

This is the best quinoa salad I've ever made! Perfect for my lunch! I chop the garlic and let it marinate in the olive oil for a day and sometimes as much as a week. It gets better as the week goes on! Love this!
Delicious! My husband even liked it and he rarely eats vegetables let alone quinoa!

I made this using the suggestion of other reviews, and cutting the amount of quinoa in half, it turned out to be spot on! I was a little concerned at leaving all the rest of the ingredients the same, but it worked great! The only other adjustment I made was to toast the quinoa in a dry pan for about 10 minutes before cooking it. This step really brings out the nutty flavor and, IMHO, enhances the whole dish! I also make my own Greek salad dressing, and, in the future, will try adding it in place of the dressing called for, pretty much the same flavor profile anyway. This was a wonderful salad, both my husband and I loved it, will definitely be making this again!
Delicious! I have never had quinoa and this was a tasty dish!
Great recipe! It was my first time mincing garlic and cooking quinoa, and it turned out perfectly! I also added cilantro and avocado to it...thanks for the recipe.
This was so delicious, my husband and I loved the melding of the flavors! Thank you :)
It was very good!
Very good and very forgiving!
I just made this and it is so yummy and easy to make! Tastes delicious over eggs in the morning!

This is one of my go to potluck recipes and always a big hit. I boost the add-ins a little; this is an easy thing to adjust for your preferences. I also whisk the vinaigrette ingredients to emulsify them and make a dressing rather than pouring them over the salad individually. You can go wrong with this salad!
I make this almost once a week. It is flavorful and delicious!
Excellent! I am going to try it with cooked onions next time just as a preference. It was even better the next day.
To much quinoa vs Greek ingredients, I used about 2/3rds of what I made and it was still a little heavy. Also could taste a bit to much red wine vinegar. Will try again with adjustments.
Both my visiting veggie son and I loved it!

My new favorite quinoa salad! Only made a couple of changes: mistakenly opened beef broth carton, so used beef broth instead of chicken broth, and must say, it was delicious. I used sherry vinegar (out of red wine vinegar), added 1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper, and doubled the amount of kalamata olives. A very tasty, healthy salad!

I used 1/2 the amount of quinoa (! cup in 2 cups water and 1/2 bouillion cube, the same quantity of all of the other ingredients except a little less olive oil, and added 2 cups of chopped fresh lettuce, making a wonderful salad. Perfect

I've had quinoa in my pantry literally for years but never used it - deferring to the more familiar rice every time. I tried this recipe yesterday and I've joined the ranks of quinoa lovers. I love this salad. I left out the olives because my SO hates them but I added them to my portion and they only made it even better. I loosely followed the measurements, added cucumber and several different coloured peppers. I'll definitely make this all summer long.
Tasted great! I think I'd add a little more of the dressing (oil, vinegar, lemon juice) to make it pop a little more.

Quite good. Used fresh basil instead of parsley plus added diced bell peppers which gave it a nice crunch. Lemon is HUGELY important ingredient. My wife and I each had seconds:)
EDIT - I realize I forgot to add the red wine vinegar. Will have to try again:)

This salad is great. I'm gluten free and it is a nice substitute for a macaroni salad. I added cucumbers (English) that gives it a nice crunch and freshness and made 1.5 the dressing . to keep it moist. Thanks for a great recipe

Super excited for supper tonight; this tastes amazing. I followed other reviewers advice and cut the quinoa down to about 1/2 the suggested amount, but kept everything else the same amount. I also added 1 cup of diced cucumbers.

Made as written, though added some red and yellow sweet peppers. Cucumber would be a nice addition too. I thought the proportions were off a bit- lots and lots of quinoa for the small amount of veggies.
I added some cucumber and skipped the parsley. So delicious - I love greek salad and this makes it a meal.

Great salad. Easy to assemble. Didn't have red wine vinegar so used apple cider vinegar. Was delicious. Let sit in the refrig for 4 - 5 hrs and the taste melded in each bite. Thank you for the fast, easy put together recipe.
Didn't add the feta but added broccoli and green beans. Delightful!
Loved this recipe! Added green and red peppers, additional tomatoes and cucumbers to give it more crunch. Turned out amazing.

I just finished making this and so far it's delicious! A hit with my brother and boyfriend which is always the ultimate goal. It needs to chill in the fridge for a while but i am sure it's only going to get better. I did end up however adding more of the dressing and quite a bit more veggies and some artichoke hearts and cucumber as well... I'm not sure but my quinoa to veggie/dressing ratio seemed way off. There was just soo much quinoa! Never a bad thing i suppose. Anyhoo this recipe was great and i will definitely be making it again. Thanks!!

A huge hit at the potluck! My adjustments: no olives (yuck!lol), quinoa cooked per package instructions (1:2 parts broth), extra TBSP red wine vinegar, 1/2 cup chopped Italian parsley + 1/2 cup chopped fresh mint, 4 diced English snacking cucumbers. It was delicious for days, and I had multiple people bugging me for the recipe.

This my first experience cooking quinoa, but I love Greek flavors. I worried I had done something wrong cooking the quinoa, it looked like some sort of porridge cooking towards the end. But it turned out fine! And this recipe makes a lot! I cut in half and it filled my usual salad bowl. The only other changes I made were the addition of cucumber and a teaspoon of oregano. I forgot to add the lemon juice, but I don't miss it. It's delicious!
